required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of a Long Term, High Intensity and Long Time Stretch Training Program on Viscoelasticity Plantarflexors Muscle in Children With Cerebral Palsy (CP).
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Long Term, High Intensity and Long Time Stretch Training Program on Viscoelasticity Plantarflexors Muscle in Children With Cerebral Palsy (CP).

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: Children with cerebral palsy present early in the childhood altered muscular properties, as soon as structural or stiffness. In the gastrocnemius muscle, altered muscular properties are characterized by short muscle belly length and increased stiffness which contribute to contracture and limiting joint range of motion.

detailed_description.textblock: This study assess efficacy of a long term stretching program of plantarflexors muscle on their viscoelasticity properties and maximal dorsiflexion angle gain. Stretching program is characterized by 3 phases: baseline, intervention and follow-up.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The methodology used is : Single Case Experimental Design (SCED).

primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the slope of the torque-angle curve in Nm/°. It is measured by isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the maximal dorsiflexion angle in degrees. It is measured by isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: Slope of the torque- MyoTendinous Junction (MTJ) displacement
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the Slope of the torque- MyoTendinous Junction (MTJ) displacement in cm/°. It is measured by isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: MyoTendinous Junction (MTJ) displacement of muscle triceps sural
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the MyoTendinous Junction (MTJ) displacement of muscle triceps sural in cm. It is measured by isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: muscle triceps sural, muscle body of the medial gastrocnemius muscle and Achilles tendon
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the length of Musculo-Tendinous Unit (MTU) of muscle triceps sural, muscle body of the medial gastrocnemius muscle and Achilles tendon. It is measured by isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound.
Analysis of the discomfort level. It is measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS) completed by children. 0 = no discomfort and 10 = maximum discomfort

arm_group.description: Children with spastic cerebral palsy will be included. They will have 3 phases: Baseline: 4, 5 or 6 evaluations Intervention: 9 evaluations before and after every stretching session Follow-up: 4, 5 or 6 evaluations The evaluation part will be composed of isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound and Visual Analog Scale (VAS). The number of evaluations at baseline and follow-up will be randomized before the study by Single Case Experimental Design (SCED) methodology.

intervention.description: children are lying prone on a isokinetic dynamometer with ultrasound which stretches spastic and paretic plantarflexors muscles very slowly until maximal torque tolerated. The parameters can be measured.
the discomfort level will be measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS) completed by children. 0 = no discomfort and 10 = maximum discomfort
the ankle of children will be mobilized for 5 minutes (first two weeks) to 10 minutes (last two weeks).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 8 to 16 years
- Children diagnosed spastic cerebral palsy
- Children with decrease maximal dorsiflexion angle under +5° in the last four weeks
- Children who don't understand instructions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who had damage orthopedics or surgical operation contraindicating realization of the experimental protocol
- Hospitalization incompatible with the progress of the protocol.
- Children who had botulinum injection, extensions casts or the implementation of new equipment (night or day orthosis) for less than three months or the progress of the protocol.
- Children having analgesic treatment in progress
